synopsis.text:
Upon the bustling streets of Ginza, a charming British jeweler, Richard Ranashinha Dvorpian, and an upright Japanese college student, Seigi Nakata, forge an unlikely partnership in the enigmatic world of jewelry. Richard, an expert in mineralogy, owns a quaint jewelry store, "Jewelry Etranger," where he appraises gems and uncovers the concealed stories within them. Seigi, on the other hand, stumbles into this realm after a chance encounter with Richard, which leads to the appraisal of a mysterious ring left behind by his late grandmother.

As Seigi begins working part-time at Richard's store, the duo delves into a series of jewel-related mysteries, unveiling the hidden psychological aspects and unspoken desires of their clients. Each gem they encounter carries its own unique tale, and the pair works diligently to empathize with and understand these stories.

While navigating the complexities of their cases, Seigi and Richard's relationship evolves, and it becomes apparent that each of them harbors secrets yet to be revealed. As they continue to solve these captivating jewel mysteries, the bond between the charismatic jeweler and the justice-seeking college student grows stronger, illuminating the intricate world of jewels and the emotions they hold.
